body.p: In this context, the complement of event L, "not L," is the event that:

multiple_choice.choice: the patient will experience both side effects.
the patient will experience only one of the two side effects.
the patient will experience neither of the two side effects.
the patient will experience at least one of the two side effects.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The event L is that the patient will experience at least one of the two side effects. This means that for event L to occur, one of three things needs to happen: either the patient experiences I, or the patient experiences H or the patient experiences both I and H. Your answer is not correct because it is one of the ways in which event L can occur. What needs to happen, then, for event L not to occur?

Incorrect. The event L is that the patient experiences at least one of the two side effects. This means that for event L to occur, one of three things needs to happen: either the patient experiences I, or the patient experiences H or the patient experiences both I and H. Your answer is not correct because it describes two of the three ways in which event L can occur. What needs to happen, then, for event L not to occur?

Good job! The event L is that the patient experiences at least one of the side effects. This means that for event L to occur, one of three things needs to happen: either the patient experiences I, or the patient experiences H or the patient experiences both I and H. Your answer is correct because it describes the only way in which event L will not occur: the patient does not experience either one of the two side effects.

Incorrect. The event L is that the patient experiences at least one of the two side effects, meaning that the patient will experience either one of the side effects or both. Your answer is not correct, because it simply restates what event L is. What needs to happen, then, for event L not to occur?
